title: About Me

Daniel Dai
Hi, I’m Daniel, a fourth-year student at UCLA, majoring in Statistics & Data Science and Applied Mathematics. I am deeply interested in machine learning and its applications in finance. Feel free to connect!

title: Research & Projects
text: Currently studying diffusion models for virtual staining applications under the supervision of Hanlong Chen at the Ozcan Research Group. I have completed a term report on the initial findings and am now working to replicate these results using flow matching techniques. (Fall25 Term Report)

title: Research & Projects
text:
Past Projects

Stats 101C Final Project (Regression): Predicting Monthly Total Sales on Amazon by State Using Amazon Survey Data
Stats 101C Final Project (Classification): Predicting the 2020 Presidential Election County Winners - Trump vs. Biden
Research Paper (MIT): Assessing the Impact of COVID-19 on US Job Openings: An ARIMA Model Analysis Supervision: Dr. Peter Kempthorne
Stats 140XP Capstone: Civilian Impact of U.S. Drone vs. Non-Drone Strikes in Somalia and Yemen

title: Datatalks Consulting
text:
I co-founded Datatalks Consulting at UCLA in 2024 and currently serve as the President. I have always championed the idea of giving back to the community, aiming to use data skills to create meaningful impact and improve society.
Since our founding, we have collaborated with 8 non-profit organizations across Southern California, supporting causes including animal welfare, LGBTQ+ rights, conservation corps, and more.
Visit our LinkedIn
